title: Intranasal DNA Vaccine for Protection against Respiratory Infectious Diseases: The Delivery Perspectives
text:
Liposomes are vesicles comprised of phospholipid bilayers
 Effective mucosal immunity often correlates with the uptake of antigen by mucosal inductive tissues, such as NALT in the upper respiratory tract following intranasal immunization
 Apart from cellular uptake, particle size also affects the kinetics of lymphatic drainage
 In addition, the overlying epithelium of mucosal follicles forms a specialized cell layer
authors: Xu, Yingying; Yuen, Pak-Wai; Lam, Jenny Ka-Wing

title: Aerosol Generating Procedures and Risk of Transmission of Acute Respiratory Infections to Healthcare Workers: A Systematic Review
text: Procedures that might promote the generation of droplets or aerosols (nonexhaustive list) included non-invasive ventilation (CPAP and BiPAP), endotracheal intubation, airway suctioning, high frequency oscillatory ventilation, bag-valve mask ventilation, chest physiotherapy, nebulizer therapies, aerosol humidification, bronchoscopy or other upper airway endoscopy, tracheotomy, and open thoracotomy
authors: Tran, Khai; Cimon, Karen; Severn, Melissa; Pessoa-Silva, Carmem L.; Conly, John

title: Evaluation of the survivability of MS2 viral aerosols deposited on filtering face piece respirator samples incorporating antimicrobial technologies
text: The aerosol particles undergo desiccation to become droplet nuclei
authors: Rengasamy, Samy; Fisher, Edward; Shaffer, Ronald E.
